title: A Cuomo comeback? In sweltering heat, NYC to vote in mayor primary
shortDescription: New York City Democrats head to the polls on June 24 to vote in citywide elections that will determine their party's nominee for mayor.

title: Trump blocked from barring Harvard's international students
shortDescription: A federal judge blocked the Trump administration from carrying out its latest bid to curtail Harvard's ability to host international students.

title: Trump announces Israel, Iran ceasefire
shortDescription: President Donald Trump says Israel and Iran agreed to a cease-fire after Iran retaliated for U.S. strikes on three nuclear facilities.

title: Cuomo, Mamdani on campaign trail before NYC mayoral primary election

title: Trump's Golden Dome missile defense system
shortDescription: Is President Donald Trump's proposed Golden Dome our best option for preventing a missile strike?

title: Pakistan condemns Trump one day after nominating him for Nobel prize
shortDescription: Pakistan initially claimed they were nominating Trump as "a genuine peacemaker" for his role in bringing a four-day conflict with India to an end.

title: Court backs Trump on migrant deportation policy

title: Trump: Attack on Al Udeid got revenge out of Iran's 'system'

title: WhatsApp banned by US House of Representatives over security concerns

title: See the changes: Trump directs major Rose Garden remodel
shortDescription: The president has called for a variety of style changes to the White House, inside and out, since taking office again.

title: Supreme Court gives Trump a win on deporting migrants
shortDescription: The administration asked the Supreme Court to lift a judge's order requiring migrants be able to contest their removal to countries other than their own.

title: What to know: Senate takes up Trump's tax and immigration bill

title: Can Trump have a 3rd presidential term? How he said it could happen

title: TACO Trump meaning: Why the phrase is resurfacing in political discourse
shortDescription: "TACO trade" was coined in May about President Trump's whiplash tariff policies. Here's what it means and why it's resurfacing in political discourse.
